name: The Oberoi Udaivilas
shortDescription: Experience royal luxury at The Oberoi Udaivilas, Udaipur's most prestigious palace hotel offering breathtaking Lake Pichola views for unforgettable destination weddings.
longDescription:
Nestled on the banks of the legendary Lake Pichola, The Oberoi Udaivilas stands as the crown jewel of luxury wedding venues in India. This magnificent palace hotel redefines opulence with its intricate architecture inspired by the royal palaces of Rajasthan, creating an enchanting backdrop for the most spectacular destination weddings. As one of Udaipur's premier wedding venues, The Oberoi Udaivilas offers couples an unparalleled blend of traditional Rajasthani grandeur and contemporary luxury, making every wedding celebration a truly regal affair.

The venue's architectural splendor is immediately evident through its grand domes, intricate frescos, and magnificent courtyards adorned with reflection pools and landscaped gardens. Every corner of this luxury wedding venue tells a story of Rajasthan's glorious heritage, from the hand-painted walls featuring traditional motifs to the opulent interiors decorated with gold-leaf embellishments and crystal chandeliers. For couples seeking an authentic palace wedding experience in Udaipur, The Oberoi Udaivilas delivers beyond imagination.

What sets The Oberoi Udaivilas apart as a premier destination wedding venue is its spectacular lakeside location. The venue offers multiple wedding spaces, each providing breathtaking views of Lake Pichola and the majestic City Palace. The lakeside lawns, spanning over 30,000 square feet, can accommodate grand celebrations for up to 400 guests, while maintaining an intimate atmosphere that makes every attendee feel part of something extraordinary. Imagine exchanging vows as the sun sets over the Aravalli hills, painting the sky in hues of gold and crimson, reflected in the tranquil waters of Lake Pichola.

The venue's wedding planning team brings decades of expertise in orchestrating elaborate Indian weddings, from intimate ceremonies to grand multi-day celebrations. They work closely with couples to customize every detail, ensuring that traditional rituals are honored while incorporating modern touches that reflect the couple's unique story. The culinary team excels in creating bespoke menus featuring authentic Rajasthani delicacies, contemporary Indian cuisine, and international favorites, all prepared with the finest ingredients and presented with artistic flair.

Accommodation at The Oberoi Udaivilas is equally impressive, with 87 luxurious rooms and suites, many featuring private pools and unobstructed lake views. Guest comfort is paramount, with world-class amenities including an award-winning spa, temperature-controlled pools, and personalized butler service ensuring every wedding attendee enjoys a memorable stay. The venue's attention to detail extends to arranging cultural performances, elephant processions, vintage car entries, and fireworks displays that add authentic Rajasthani flavor to wedding celebrations.

For couples planning a luxury wedding in Rajasthan, The Oberoi Udaivilas offers comprehensive wedding packages that include accommodation, multiple venue spaces, décor, catering, and coordination services. The property's exclusive nature means only one wedding is hosted at a time, ensuring complete privacy and undivided attention from the dedicated staff. Whether planning a traditional Hindu ceremony, a Christian wedding by the lake, or a fusion celebration blending cultures, The Oberoi Udaivilas provides the perfect canvas for creating timeless memories that will be cherished for generations.

faqs.question: How far in advance should we book The Oberoi Udaivilas for a wedding?
faqs.answer: We recommend booking at least 12-18 months in advance for peak season dates (October-March). For off-peak periods, 6-9 months advance booking is advisable. The property's one-wedding-at-a-time policy means popular dates fill quickly, especially during winter months and auspicious wedding dates.

faqs.question: What is the minimum stay requirement for wedding bookings?
faqs.answer: For wedding celebrations, a minimum stay of 2-3 nights is typically required, depending on the season and scale of the event. During peak wedding season (November-February), a minimum of 3 nights may be mandatory. This ensures adequate time for all wedding functions and guest experiences.

faqs.question: Can all wedding guests be accommodated on the property?
faqs.answer: The Oberoi Udaivilas has 87 luxury rooms and suites that can accommodate approximately 150-170 guests. For larger weddings, the hotel has partnerships with nearby premium properties including The Oberoi Rajvilas and select heritage hotels. The wedding team coordinates overflow accommodation seamlessly.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum food and beverage spend requirement?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a minimum F&B commitment that varies based on season and event dates. During peak season, the minimum ranges from ₹25-40 lakhs depending on the number of events. This includes all meals, beverages, and catering for wedding functions. Detailed proposals are provided during venue consultation.

faqs.question: Is outside catering allowed at The Oberoi Udaivilas?
faqs.answer: Outside catering is generally not permitted as The Oberoi maintains strict quality and hygiene standards. However, specialty items like specific regional sweets or family recipe preparations may be allowed on a case-by-case basis with advance approval and proper food safety compliance.

faqs.question: What are the decoration guidelines and restrictions?
faqs.answer: The hotel has an in-house decoration team and works with approved external decorators. Restrictions include no permanent fixtures on heritage structures, mandatory use of fire-retardant materials, no real candles in certain areas, and prior approval required for any suspended installations. Eco-friendly decorations are encouraged.

faqs.question: What are the music and DJ timing restrictions?
faqs.answer: Outdoor venues permit music and DJ until 10:00 PM as per local regulations. Indoor venues like the banquet hall allow music until 11:00 PM. Sound levels are monitored to ensure compliance. Acoustic and unplugged music can continue longer in designated areas.

faqs.question: Are photography and videography allowed in all areas?
faqs.answer: Professional photography and videography are welcomed throughout the property. Drone photography requires prior permission and may have altitude restrictions near the lake. Certain private guest areas may have limitations. The hotel can recommend experienced local photographers familiar with the property.

faqs.question: What backup plans exist for outdoor events in case of unexpected weather?
faqs.answer: The Oberoi Udaivilas has comprehensive weather contingency plans. The Raj Mahal banquet hall serves as an elegant indoor backup for outdoor events. Covered pavilions and tented structures can be arranged with advance notice. The wedding team monitors weather forecasts closely and coordinates alternatives proactively.

faqs.question: What is the cancellation and refund policy for weddings?
faqs.answer: Cancellations made 90+ days before the event forfeit 25% of the total booking amount. Cancellations 60-89 days before forfeit 50%, 30-59 days forfeit 75%, and less than 30 days result in 100% forfeiture. Date changes may be accommodated subject to availability with applicable charges. Comprehensive wedding insurance is recommended.

name: Taj Lake Palace
shortDescription: Float on Lake Pichola in this 18th-century marble palace hotel, offering India's most exclusive and romantic island wedding venue with unmatched privacy and grandeur.
longDescription:
The Taj Lake Palace represents the pinnacle of luxury destination weddings in India, offering an experience so unique and exclusive that it remains unmatched globally. Built in 1746 by Maharana Jagat Singh II, this magnificent white marble palace literally floats on Lake Pichola, accessible only by private boat, creating an atmosphere of complete seclusion and romance. As one of the world's most photographed hotels and frequently listed among the most romantic wedding venues globally, the Taj Lake Palace transforms wedding dreams into extraordinary reality.

This architectural masterpiece, rising like a vision from the tranquil waters of Lake Pichola, features stunning white marble walls adorned with intricate carvings, beautiful courtyards decorated with lotus pools, and terraces offering 360-degree views of Udaipur's enchanting landscape. Every corner of this heritage property exudes royal elegance, from the grand lily pond courtyard to the magnificent Jharokha Suite with its stunning crystal and colored glass work. For couples seeking an intimate luxury wedding in Rajasthan, the Taj Lake Palace offers unparalleled exclusivity and romance.

What truly distinguishes the Taj Lake Palace as a premier destination wedding venue is its island location providing absolute privacy and security. Wedding celebrations here feel like private royal affairs, with the entire palace available for complete buyouts, ensuring your special day remains truly exclusive. The venue accommodates intimate weddings for 30 to 150 guests, perfect for couples who prioritize quality over quantity and seek a refined, elegant celebration rather than a massive gathering.

The palace's wedding spaces are nothing short of spectacular. The main courtyard, surrounded by carved marble pillars and overlooking the lake, creates a magical setting for ceremonies and receptions. The Mewar Terrace offers breathtaking sunset views, ideal for cocktail hours and sangeet ceremonies, while the Jharokha Suite and Palace rooms provide luxurious accommodation for the couple and key family members. Every wedding space within the palace offers picture-perfect backdrops, making photographer's dreams come true.

The Taj Lake Palace's culinary team excels in creating bespoke dining experiences, from traditional Rajasthani thalis served in solid silver to contemporary fusion menus that delight international palates. Private dining can be arranged on various terraces, poolside, or even on a boat floating in the middle of Lake Pichola. The attention to detail in menu planning, presentation, and service reflects the palace's commitment to creating unforgettable memories.

Wedding planning services at the Taj Lake Palace are exceptionally comprehensive, with dedicated teams handling everything from traditional décor incorporating marigold flowers and traditional Rajasthani fabrics to modern lighting installations that transform the palace into a fairytale venue after sunset. The palace arranges authentic cultural experiences including folk dance performances, traditional musicians, royal processions with horses and elephants, and spectacular fireworks displays over the lake. The Jiva Spa offers pre-wedding wellness treatments inspired by ancient Indian healing traditions, ensuring the couple and wedding party feel pampered and relaxed.

For international couples and NRI families planning destination weddings in India, the Taj Lake Palace offers the perfect combination of authentic Indian heritage and world-class luxury amenities. The property's 66 rooms and suites, though limited in number, ensure intimate celebrations where every guest receives personalized attention. The concierge team assists with arranging city tours, visits to nearby palaces and temples, shopping excursions in Udaipur's famous bazaars, and other activities to make the wedding experience memorable for all attendees. Choosing the Taj Lake Palace for your wedding means choosing not just a venue, but a legendary experience that becomes part of your family's history.

faqs.question: How far in advance should we book Taj Lake Palace for a wedding?
faqs.answer: Due to the palace's limited capacity and extreme popularity, we recommend booking 18-24 months in advance for peak season dates (October-March). For full property buyouts, even earlier booking is advisable. The palace hosts very few weddings annually, making early planning essential.

faqs.question: What is the minimum stay requirement for wedding events?
faqs.answer: A minimum stay of 3 nights is typically required for wedding celebrations at Taj Lake Palace. For full property buyouts, which is recommended for weddings, the minimum may extend to 4 nights depending on the season. This allows adequate time for all ceremonies and ensures an unhurried experience.

faqs.question: How many guests can be accommodated on the island?
faqs.answer: The Taj Lake Palace has 66 rooms and suites accommodating approximately 120-130 guests. Given the island's exclusive nature, all wedding guests should ideally stay on-property for the full experience. Overflow arrangements can be made at sister properties like Taj Fateh Prakash Palace on the mainland with boat transfers.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum food and beverage requirement?
faqs.answer: Yes, minimum F&B commitments apply and vary significantly based on season and whether it's a full property buyout. During peak season, minimums typically start from ₹35-50 lakhs for weddings. This includes all meals, beverage service, and catering for wedding functions. Custom proposals are provided based on guest count and event scale.

faqs.question: Can we bring outside caterers to the island?
faqs.answer: Outside catering is not permitted due to the island's logistical constraints and the hotel's quality standards. The Taj culinary team is highly experienced in creating elaborate wedding menus including specific regional cuisines, family recipes, and dietary requirements. Specialty items may be accommodated with advance discussion.

faqs.question: What decoration restrictions apply to the heritage palace?
faqs.answer: The palace's 18th-century heritage status requires strict decoration guidelines. No fixtures can be attached to marble surfaces, no naked flames in certain areas, and all materials must be fire-retardant. The hotel's decoration team specializes in creating stunning setups within these guidelines. External decorators must receive orientation on heritage protocols.

faqs.question: What are the music timing restrictions on the lake?
faqs.answer: Due to sound traveling across the lake, outdoor music is permitted until 10:00 PM. Indoor venues allow music until 10:30 PM. Traditional musicians and acoustic performances may continue slightly longer in designated areas. The intimate island setting creates magical ambiance even without amplified late-night music.

faqs.question: Is drone photography permitted at the palace?
faqs.answer: Drone photography requires special permissions due to the heritage site status and proximity to City Palace. Requests must be submitted at least 30 days in advance. When approved, specific flight zones and timing restrictions apply. The hotel can recommend experienced drone operators familiar with local regulations.

faqs.question: What happens if there's unexpected rain during our wedding?
faqs.answer: The palace has beautiful indoor venues including Bada Mahal that serve as weather backups. Covered areas and pavilions provide additional protection. The wedding team monitors weather forecasts continuously and proactively prepares contingency plans. The monsoon season (July-September) is generally not recommended for outdoor ceremonies.

faqs.question: What is the payment and cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: A 40% advance confirms the booking, with 30% due 90 days prior and the final 30% due 30 days before the event. Cancellations 120+ days before forfeit 30%, 90-119 days forfeit 50%, 60-89 days forfeit 75%, and less than 60 days forfeit 100%. Wedding insurance is highly recommended given the significant investment.

name: Umaid Bhawan Palace
shortDescription: One of the world's largest private residences, Umaid Bhawan Palace offers ultra-exclusive royal weddings in Jodhpur with unmatched grandeur and Art Deco elegance.
longDescription:
Umaid Bhawan Palace stands as one of the world's most extraordinary wedding venues, a magnificent Art Deco palace that remains a residence of the Jodhpur royal family while offering ultra-exclusive destination wedding experiences. Built between 1929 and 1943 for Maharaja Umaid Singh, this architectural marvel spans 26 acres of landscaped gardens and comprises 347 rooms, making it one of the largest private residences in the world. As the preferred venue for India's most high-profile celebrity weddings, Umaid Bhawan Palace represents the absolute pinnacle of luxury destination weddings.

The palace's architecture is a stunning fusion of Eastern and Western influences, blending Art Deco design with traditional Indian motifs. The interior features the finest Makrana marble, Burma teak, and hand-painted murals that took fourteen years to complete. The legendary Throne Room with its 105-foot high dome, the palm-court styled inner courtyard, and the elaborate underground swimming pool create an atmosphere of unprecedented grandeur. Every corner of Umaid Bhawan Palace tells a story of uncompromising luxury and royal heritage that few venues in the world can match.

What makes Umaid Bhawan Palace truly exceptional as a wedding venue is its exclusivity and the genuine royal experience it offers. Unlike heritage hotels that merely recreate palatial settings, this is an actual functioning palace where the Jodhpur royal family still resides. Wedding guests experience authentic royal hospitality, often greeted by members of the royal family themselves. The palace offers complete buyout options, ensuring absolute privacy for the most discerning couples, making it a favorite for celebrity weddings and ultra-high-net-worth families seeking incomparable exclusivity.

The palace offers diverse wedding venues, each more spectacular than the last. The sprawling Baradari Lawns can accommodate grand celebrations for up to 500 guests under the majestic backdrop of the palace's iconic dome. The Museum Courtyard provides an intimate setting surrounded by vintage cars and royal artifacts, while the Marwar Hall offers a magnificent indoor venue for lavish wedding dinners. The private Royal Suite, with its own swimming pool and panoramic views, serves as the ultimate bridal preparation space.

Culinary experiences at Umaid Bhawan Palace are legendary, with royal kitchens that have preserved recipes from the Jodhpur royal household for generations. The palace's chefs create extraordinary wedding feasts featuring authentic Marwari cuisine, elaborate multi-course royal thalis, and international gourmet options. Private dining can be arranged in various palace settings, from romantic terrace dinners overlooking the Blue City to grand banquets in the Maharaja's private dining room. The wine cellar, one of India's finest, offers carefully curated selections for discerning guests.

The palace operates as a Taj Hotels property, ensuring world-class hospitality while maintaining authentic royal traditions. The wedding planning team has orchestrated some of India's most celebrated weddings, bringing together traditional Marwari ceremonies with contemporary luxury seamlessly. Entertainment options include private performances by renowned artists, spectacular fireworks displays visible across Jodhpur, vintage car processions, and cultural programs that showcase Rajasthan's rich heritage. For couples seeking the most exclusive and memorable wedding experience possible, Umaid Bhawan Palace offers an unparalleled celebration that will be discussed for generations.

name: Taj Exotica Resort & Spa
shortDescription: Goa's premier beachfront luxury resort offering stunning Arabian Sea views, Mediterranean architecture, and world-class facilities for unforgettable beach destination weddings.
longDescription:
Taj Exotica Resort & Spa stands as Goa's most celebrated luxury wedding destination, offering couples an extraordinary blend of pristine beachfront beauty, Mediterranean-inspired elegance, and legendary Taj hospitality. Spread across 56 acres of lush tropical gardens along Benaulim Beach in South Goa, this stunning resort provides an idyllic setting for romantic beach weddings that dreams are made of. As the flagship beach resort of Taj Hotels, Taj Exotica has hosted countless memorable celebrations, earning its reputation as India's premier beach wedding venue.

The resort's architecture draws inspiration from Indo-Portuguese design, featuring terracotta roofs, whitewashed walls, and beautiful archways that complement the coastal Goan landscape. The property opens directly onto Benaulim Beach, one of Goa's most pristine stretches of golden sand, where couples can exchange vows with the Arabian Sea as their backdrop. The manicured lawns, tropical gardens, and elegant poolside areas provide diverse settings for various wedding functions, from intimate ceremonies to grand celebrations accommodating up to 400 guests.

What sets Taj Exotica apart from other Goa wedding venues is its perfect balance of beach resort luxury and sophisticated elegance. The resort offers multiple venue options, each designed to maximize the natural beauty of the coastal setting. The beachfront lawns provide spectacular sunset wedding backdrops, while the grand ballroom offers climate-controlled comfort for elaborate wedding dinners. The pool deck and tropical gardens are ideal for mehendi ceremonies and cocktail parties, creating a cohesive celebration that flows naturally across the property.

The resort's culinary team excels in creating memorable wedding feasts that showcase Goan coastal cuisine alongside pan-Indian and international favorites. Fresh seafood, traditional Goan delicacies, and elaborate multi-cuisine spreads can be customized to suit every palate. The signature Goan wedding experience might include a traditional Goan fish curry feast on the beach, paired with local feni and wines, creating authentic local flavor that destination wedding guests treasure.

Accommodation at Taj Exotica features 140 luxurious rooms, suites, and villas, many with private gardens, plunge pools, and direct beach access. The Presidential Villa and Garden Villas offer exclusive spaces for the wedding couple and their families, complete with butler service and private dining arrangements. The Jiva Spa provides comprehensive pre-wedding relaxation packages, while multiple dining venues, including the beachfront restaurant and sunset bar, ensure wedding guests enjoy varied experiences throughout their stay.

The wedding planning team at Taj Exotica brings extensive experience in executing beach weddings, understanding the nuances of outdoor celebrations in tropical settings. From managing weather contingencies to creating spectacular lighting installations that transform the beach at night, the team ensures flawless execution. Entertainment can include traditional Goan folk performances, live bands, DJ setups, and spectacular firework displays over the Arabian Sea. For couples dreaming of a perfect beach wedding in India, Taj Exotica Goa delivers an experience that combines tropical romance with world-class luxury.

name: The Leela Palace New Delhi
shortDescription: Delhi's most prestigious urban palace hotel offering opulent interiors, world-class facilities, and Lutyens' Delhi grandeur for magnificent city destination weddings.
longDescription:
The Leela Palace New Delhi stands as the capital's most distinguished luxury wedding venue, offering couples an unparalleled urban palace experience in the heart of diplomatic Delhi. Situated in the prestigious Chanakyapuri area, overlooking the historic Rashtrapati Bhavan and surrounded by embassies, this magnificent hotel combines the grandeur of a royal palace with contemporary luxury and legendary Leela hospitality. As one of Asia's finest urban hotels, The Leela Palace New Delhi has earned its reputation as the preferred venue for society weddings, diplomatic celebrations, and grand Indian festivities.

The hotel's architecture pays homage to the Lutyens era, featuring imposing columns, grand archways, and a stunning porte-cochère that sets the tone for the palatial experience within. The interiors showcase an extraordinary collection of artworks, including museum-quality paintings, handcrafted chandeliers, and bespoke furnishings that create an atmosphere of refined opulence. The legendary Peacock corridor, featuring 24-carat gold leaf artwork and Italian marble, provides one of Delhi's most photographed wedding backdrops, while the grand staircase serves as the perfect setting for bridal entrances.

What distinguishes The Leela Palace as a premier wedding venue is its combination of palatial grandeur and modern functionality. The property offers exceptional event spaces that cater to celebrations of varying scales. The pillarless ballroom, one of Delhi's largest, can accommodate up to 600 guests for grand receptions, while maintaining an intimate ambiance through clever design. The Royal Terrace offers spectacular city views and open-air celebrations, while smaller function rooms provide elegant settings for intimate ceremonies and pre-wedding functions.

Culinary excellence at The Leela Palace is legendary, with acclaimed restaurants including Le Cirque for Italian, Jamavar for fine Indian, and MEGU for Japanese cuisine. For weddings, the culinary team creates bespoke menus that blend traditional Indian wedding feasts with contemporary global cuisine. The palace's kitchens have catered to numerous heads of state and dignitaries, bringing the same exacting standards to wedding celebrations. From elaborate multi-day wedding feasts to intimate engagement dinners, every culinary moment is crafted to perfection.

Accommodation features 254 luxurious rooms and suites, including the spectacular Presidential Suite and Royal Club floors. The rooms blend traditional Indian aesthetics with contemporary comfort, featuring handpicked artworks, marble bathrooms, and technology integration that caters to modern guests. The ESPA spa offers comprehensive bridal packages, while the rooftop pool provides a serene escape for wedding guests. The Leela's butler service ensures every guest receives personalized attention throughout their stay.

The wedding planning team at The Leela Palace brings together decades of experience in executing Delhi's most celebrated weddings. From coordinating with the city's finest decorators and entertainment providers to managing complex logistics for multi-day celebrations, the team ensures every detail is flawlessly handled. The hotel's central location provides easy access to Delhi's historic sites for pre-wedding photography, while its security and privacy protocols meet the expectations of the most discerning clientele. For couples seeking a grand urban palace wedding in India's capital, The Leela Palace New Delhi offers an experience of uncompromising luxury and elegance.

name: Rambagh Palace
shortDescription: The former residence of the Maharaja of Jaipur, Rambagh Palace offers India's most storied royal heritage wedding experience with magnificent Mughal gardens and palatial grandeur.
longDescription:
Rambagh Palace, often called the 'Jewel of Jaipur,' stands as India's most celebrated heritage hotel and an extraordinary wedding venue steeped in royal history. Originally built in 1835 as a garden house for the queen's favorite handmaiden, it was later transformed into a hunting lodge and eventually became the beloved residence of Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II and his queen, Gayatri Devi. Today, as a Taj Hotels property, Rambagh Palace opens its gates to couples seeking to write their own chapter in its storied history, offering wedding experiences that combine authentic royal heritage with contemporary luxury.

The palace architecture showcases the finest Rajput and Mughal influences, featuring intricate lattice work, ornate pillars, exquisite marble fountains, and beautifully restored period interiors. The 47 acres of Mughal gardens are meticulously maintained, featuring manicured lawns, fragrant flower beds, ancient trees, and dancing peacocks that create a magical atmosphere. The interior spaces retain their original grandeur, with hand-painted frescoes, crystal chandeliers, and period furniture that transport guests to an era of unparalleled royal elegance.

What makes Rambagh Palace exceptional as a wedding venue is its authentic royal provenance combined with the professional execution that Taj Hotels provides. Unlike purpose-built hotels, every space within Rambagh Palace has genuine historical significance. The Marble Corridor, the Oriental Cocktail Room, and the Polo Bar all carry stories of the glamorous royal era when international celebrities and dignitaries were regular guests. Wedding celebrations here become part of this continuing legacy, offering couples a connection to India's most romantic royal history.

The palace offers diverse wedding venues that cater to celebrations of all scales. The sprawling Mughal gardens can accommodate grand celebrations for up to 500 guests, with the illuminated palace façade creating a spectacular backdrop. The Suvarna Mahal, the palace's fine dining restaurant housed in a former royal banquet hall, offers intimate dining experiences, while the various palace halls and courtyards provide settings for different wedding functions. The property's ability to host entire weddings on-site, with multiple venues for different functions, makes it ideal for elaborate multi-day celebrations.

Culinary experiences at Rambagh Palace draw from the rich heritage of the Jaipur royal kitchens. The Suvarna Mahal offers regal dining in a setting unchanged since maharaja days, complete with live classical music and impeccable service. For weddings, the culinary team creates elaborate feasts featuring authentic Rajasthani royal recipes alongside contemporary Indian and international cuisines. The palace's famous high tea and champagne receptions add sophisticated touches to wedding celebrations that guests remember long after.

Accommodation at Rambagh Palace comprises 78 rooms and suites, each uniquely decorated with period furnishings and modern amenities. The Maharani Suite and Peacock Suite offer palatial accommodations for the wedding couple, complete with private terraces and butler service. The Jiva Spa provides traditional Ayurvedic treatments for pre-wedding relaxation, while the palace's croquet lawns, polo ground, and indoor pool offer leisure activities for wedding guests. For couples dreaming of a wedding in India's most famous palace hotel, Rambagh Palace offers an experience that combines living history with legendary hospitality.

name: The Leela Goa
shortDescription: A stunning 75-acre beachfront resort inspired by ancient Goan and Portuguese architecture, offering spectacular lagoon views and Arabian Sea beach weddings.
longDescription:
The Leela Goa stands as one of India's most distinguished beach wedding destinations, a magnificent 75-acre resort that seamlessly blends ancient Goan heritage with contemporary luxury. Located on the pristine shores of Mobor Beach in South Goa, the resort is built around a natural lagoon and inspired by the architecture of the ancient City of Vijayanagara, creating a unique setting unlike any other beach resort in India. For couples seeking a destination wedding that combines beach romance with cultural richness, The Leela Goa offers an unparalleled experience.

The resort's architecture draws inspiration from the grand Vijayanagara Empire and Portuguese colonial influences, featuring dramatic laterite structures, temple-inspired gateways, and intricate stone carvings. The property is designed around a 12-acre lagoon that reflects the ornate architecture, creating spectacular visual drama, especially when illuminated for evening celebrations. The landscaping includes lush tropical gardens, ancient trees, and winding pathways that lead to various wedding venues, each offering its own distinct ambiance and character.

What distinguishes The Leela Goa as a premier wedding venue is its extraordinary variety of settings within a single property. The beachfront lawns offer traditional beach wedding backdrops with the Arabian Sea stretching to the horizon. The lagoon-facing venues provide romantic water views with the resort's architectural grandeur reflected in the tranquil waters. The riverside area offers intimate settings away from the beach, while the pool deck provides a glamorous resort atmosphere for cocktail parties and sangeet celebrations.

The resort offers 206 rooms, suites, and villas, many with private gardens, lagoon views, or direct beach access. The Lagoon Suite and Royal Villa provide exceptional accommodations for the wedding couple, with private pools, butler service, and panoramic views. The Club at The Leela offers elevated experiences for discerning guests, while the spa provides comprehensive bridal packages combining Ayurvedic traditions with contemporary treatments. Golf enthusiasts can enjoy the adjacent 12-hole golf course, adding recreational options for wedding guests.

Culinary experiences at The Leela Goa showcase the rich coastal heritage of Goan cuisine alongside sophisticated international options. The resort's restaurants include The Riverside for Goan and Susegad Portuguese-influenced dining, and Jamavar for fine Indian cuisine. For weddings, the culinary team creates memorable feasts featuring fresh seafood, traditional Goan preparations, and elaborate international spreads. Beach barbecues, poolside brunches, and formal lagoon-side dinners can all be arranged, creating diverse dining experiences across the celebration.

The wedding planning team at The Leela Goa brings decades of experience in executing beach weddings with the sophistication expected of a Leela property. From managing the logistics of outdoor celebrations to creating spectacular décor installations that complement the resort's unique architecture, the team ensures flawless execution. The property's size allows for multiple events to occur simultaneously without overlap, making it ideal for elaborate Indian weddings with numerous functions and guests requiring varied experiences.
weatherNote: Excellent beach wedding weather from October to April with temperatures 22°C to 33°C. The lagoon provides beautiful reflections during calm winter months. Monsoon season (June-September) limits outdoor events.

name: Kumarakom Lake Resort
shortDescription: Kerala's premier backwater wedding destination featuring traditional heritage villas, meandering lagoons, and authentic Kerala hospitality on Vembanad Lake.
longDescription:
Kumarakom Lake Resort stands as Kerala's most distinguished wedding destination, a magnificent heritage property spread across 25 acres of lush tropical gardens on the banks of the legendary Vembanad Lake. This extraordinary resort preserves and celebrates Kerala's rich heritage through its unique accommodation of restored ancestral homes (tharavads) relocated and reconstructed on the property, offering couples a wedding experience deeply rooted in the authentic traditions of God's Own Country.

The resort's architecture is a living museum of Kerala's traditional building arts, featuring original tharavads dating back 100-200 years, complete with intricately carved wooden ceilings, traditional tile roofs, and verandahs that open to serene backwater views. The 59 heritage villas and pool villas are nestled among coconut palms, fruit orchards, and flowering gardens, connected by stone pathways and meandering canals. The effect is of a traditional Kerala village reimagined as a luxury resort, providing wedding guests with an immersive cultural experience.

What makes Kumarakom Lake Resort exceptional as a wedding venue is its ability to offer authentic Kerala wedding experiences that few properties can match. The resort's setting on Vembanad Lake allows for spectacular kettu vallam (traditional houseboat) arrivals for the bride and groom, a uniquely Kerala tradition that creates unforgettable memories. The Aymanam House, the resort's main heritage mansion, serves as a stunning venue for traditional Kerala wedding ceremonies, complete with brass oil lamps, temple flowers, and classical music.

The property offers diverse wedding venues that showcase Kerala's natural beauty. The lakefront lawn provides breathtaking sunset backdrops with the backwaters stretching to the horizon. The meandering lagoon areas offer intimate settings for mehendi and smaller functions, while the pool villas can host exclusive gatherings for close family. The Ettukettu restaurant, housed in an eight-cornered traditional mansion, offers a spectacular indoor venue for wedding dinners surrounded by antique wooden pillars and traditional craftsmanship.

Culinary experiences at Kumarakom Lake Resort showcase Kerala's rich gastronomic heritage. The resort's chefs are masters of traditional Sadhya (Kerala feast) preparation, creating elaborate banana leaf spreads featuring over 26 vegetarian dishes prepared according to ancestral recipes. Fresh seafood from the backwaters, traditional Malabar cuisine, and contemporary Indian options complement the traditional offerings. For weddings, the culinary team can create elaborate multi-cuisine experiences while maintaining the authentic Kerala character that makes celebrations here so special.

The resort's Ayurveda spa, Ayurmana, offers comprehensive pre-wedding wellness programs based on authentic Kerala traditions. The traditional treatments, performed by trained therapists in serene settings overlooking the backwaters, help couples and their families relax and rejuvenate before celebrations. Village walks, cooking classes, canoe rides through the backwaters, and bird watching expeditions provide memorable activities for wedding guests, creating a complete destination experience beyond the ceremonies themselves.
weatherNote: Kerala has pleasant weather from September to March with temperatures 22°C to 32°C. The backwaters are especially beautiful during post-monsoon when water levels are ideal. Light showers possible year-round.

Off-peak periods may have availability with 4-6 months notice.

faqs.question: What is the minimum stay requirement for wedding celebrations?
faqs.answer: A minimum of 2 nights is typically required for wedding bookings. During peak season, 3 nights may be recommended to allow for traditional Kerala wedding ceremonies and guest experiences. This also provides time for Ayurvedic spa treatments and backwater activities.

faqs.question: Can all wedding guests be accommodated at the resort?
faqs.answer: Kumarakom Lake Resort has 59 heritage and pool villas accommodating approximately 100-120 guests. For larger weddings, the resort coordinates with nearby premium properties like Coconut Lagoon and other Kumarakom hotels. Houseboat accommodation can also add unique lodging options.

faqs.question: Is there a minimum food and beverage requirement?
faqs.answer: F&B minimums vary by season, typically starting from ₹10-18 lakhs for wedding events. This includes all meals, beverages, and catering for functions. The resort is renowned for authentic Kerala Sadhya (traditional feast) which can be incorporated into wedding meals.

faqs.question: Is outside catering permitted at the resort?
faqs.answer: Outside catering is generally not permitted to maintain quality and hygiene standards. However, the resort excels in Kerala cuisine and can accommodate specific regional dishes, family recipes, and dietary requirements. Traditional items like specific sweets may be allowed with advance coordination.

faqs.question: What decoration restrictions apply to heritage structures?
faqs.answer: Heritage tharavad structures require careful treatment - no nails, adhesives, or fixtures. Traditional Kerala decorations using temple flowers, banana leaves, and brass lamps are encouraged. All décor must be eco-friendly and biodegradable. The resort's natural setting often requires minimal additional decoration.

faqs.question: What are the music and timing guidelines?
faqs.answer: Outdoor music is permitted until 10:00 PM, with indoor venues allowing music until 10:30 PM. Traditional Kerala music (Chenda, Nadaswaram) for ceremonies is highly encouraged. The resort can arrange Kathakali and Mohiniyattam dance performances that continue as cultural entertainment.

faqs.question: Can we arrive by houseboat for the wedding?
faqs.answer: Yes! Houseboat arrivals are a highlight of Kumarakom weddings. The resort has a private jetty and can arrange decorated kettu vallam (traditional houseboats) for bride and groom arrivals. This creates a spectacular, uniquely Kerala wedding moment that guests remember forever.

faqs.question: What backup plans exist in case of rain?
faqs.answer: Aymanam House and Ettukettu provide elegant indoor alternatives for outdoor events. The resort can arrange traditional pandal (tent) structures with advance notice. Kerala's wedding season (September-March) has relatively dry weather, but the team maintains contingency plans.

faqs.question: What is the payment and cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: Payments are 25% at booking, 35% at 45 days prior, and 40% at 10 days prior. Cancellations 60+ days before forfeit 25%, 30-59 days forfeit 50%, 15-29 days forfeit 75%, less than 15 days forfeit 100%. Wedding insurance is recommended given Kerala's occasional rain.

name: Suryagarh Jaisalmer
shortDescription: Experience the magic of desert weddings at Suryagarh Jaisalmer, a magnificent fort-palace rising from the golden Thar Desert, offering unparalleled Rajasthani hospitality and celestial starlit celebrations.
longDescription:
Suryagarh Jaisalmer stands as a testament to Rajasthan's architectural grandeur, a spectacular sandstone fortress that emerges majestically from the golden dunes of the Thar Desert. This award-winning luxury resort redefines destination weddings in India, offering couples the rare opportunity to celebrate their union beneath a canopy of a million stars, surrounded by the mystical beauty of the world's most romantic desert landscape. For those seeking a wedding venue that transcends the ordinary, Suryagarh delivers an experience that feels lifted from the pages of Arabian Nights.

The property's architecture pays homage to centuries of Rajasthani craftsmanship, with intricately carved jharokhas (traditional balconies), ornate jaali work, and soaring turrets that catch the golden light of the desert sun. Every corridor reveals new artistic treasures, from hand-painted frescos depicting royal hunting scenes to antique furniture collected from the noble houses of Rajasthan. The attention to detail extends throughout the 83 luxuriously appointed suites and rooms, each offering a unique blend of heritage aesthetics and contemporary comforts.

Wedding celebrations at Suryagarh unfold across multiple breathtaking venues, each more spectacular than the last. The Dunes, a 45,000 square foot expanse of manicured lawns set against the backdrop of the Thar Desert, can accommodate grand celebrations for up to 500 guests. The Nosh restaurant terrace offers intimate dining under the stars, while the Akhara courtyard provides a traditional setting for pheras and religious ceremonies. For truly extraordinary experiences, Suryagarh arranges exclusive celebrations in the desert itself, with elaborate tent setups, camel processions, and folk performances that bring the romance of the silk road to life.

The culinary team at Suryagarh has mastered the art of desert gastronomy, presenting authentic Marwari cuisine alongside contemporary Indian and international dishes. Their signature experiences include dune-top dinners where guests feast on traditional laal maas and ker sangri while watching the sun set over the endless golden sands. The resort's extensive wine cellar and craft cocktail program ensure celebrations sparkle long into the star-filled desert nights.

What truly distinguishes Suryagarh is the desert itself. Wedding guests can explore the Thar on camelback, witness spectacular sunsets from private dune points, enjoy folk music performances by local Manganiyar musicians, and experience the profound silence of desert nights punctuated only by crackling bonfires and the distant calls of desert creatures. For couples seeking a wedding that offers adventure alongside elegance, Suryagarh creates memories that last lifetimes.

The wedding planning team at Suryagarh specializes in crafting bespoke celebrations that honor both tradition and personal style. From elaborate henna ceremonies in lantern-lit courtyards to sangeet nights featuring Rajasthani folk dancers and contemporary DJs, every event is choreographed with precision and passion. The property's remote location ensures complete privacy, while its world-class infrastructure guarantees that every luxury is available even in this magical desert setting.
weatherNote: Jaisalmer enjoys excellent weather from October to March with temperatures ranging from 8°C to 25°C, perfect for outdoor desert celebrations. Summer months (April-June) experience extreme heat exceeding 45°C and should be avoided.

faqs.question: How far in advance should we book Suryagarh for a wedding?
faqs.answer: We recommend booking 12-15 months in advance for peak season dates (November-February). The resort is particularly popular during the Jaisalmer Desert Festival period (January-February). Off-peak season weddings can be booked 6-9 months ahead.

faqs.question: Can we host events in the actual desert?
faqs.answer: Yes! Suryagarh specializes in desert camp setups for weddings. Elaborate tent arrangements, traditional seating, lighting, and catering can all be arranged in the Thar Desert for truly magical celebrations. These setups can accommodate 100-300 guests comfortably.

faqs.question: What is the weather like for winter weddings?
faqs.answer: Winter (November-February) is ideal with daytime temperatures of 20-25°C and nights around 8-12°C. The weather is perfect for outdoor ceremonies, though evening events may require heating arrangements. We recommend guests bring warm clothing for night events.

faqs.question: Are there activities for wedding guests?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! Guests can enjoy camel safaris, dune bashing, sunset points, visits to Jaisalmer Fort, shopping in local markets, folk music performances, and stargazing experiences. The resort can organize full activity itineraries for wedding guests.

faqs.question: Is outside catering allowed?
faqs.answer: The resort's culinary team handles all catering with expertise in Marwari, North Indian, and international cuisines. However, special family recipes or specific regional caterers can be accommodated with advance discussion and food safety compliance.

faqs.question: What transportation options are available for guests?
faqs.answer: Suryagarh arranges airport and railway station transfers. For the baraat, vintage cars, decorated camels, horses, and even elephants can be arranged. Desert camp transfers are handled by resort vehicles suited for sand terrain.

faqs.question: Is there a backup plan for outdoor events in case of unexpected weather?
faqs.answer: Yes, the indoor ballroom (capacity 250) and covered terrace areas provide excellent backup options. Desert weather is generally predictable in peak season, but the resort has comprehensive contingency plans including tent structures that can be erected quickly.

faqs.question: What makes Suryagarh unique for weddings?
faqs.answer: The combination of luxury resort facilities with authentic desert experiences is unmatched. No other venue offers starlit ceremonies under unpolluted desert skies, traditional Manganiyar folk performances, and world-class hospitality in such a dramatic setting.

faqs.question: How many rooms are available for guest accommodation?
faqs.answer: Suryagarh has 83 rooms and suites accommodating approximately 150-160 guests. For larger weddings, partner hotels in Jaisalmer can be arranged with shuttle services. The resort can also set up luxury desert camps for additional accommodation.

faqs.question: What are the decoration restrictions?
faqs.answer: The resort's architecture is stunning and requires minimal decoration. External decorators are welcome but must coordinate with the in-house team. Fire safety protocols apply, and desert setups have specific guidelines for environmental protection.

name: RAAS Jodhpur
shortDescription: Celebrate your union at RAAS Jodhpur, a stunning boutique heritage hotel nestled at the base of the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort, blending 18th-century Rajasthani architecture with contemporary luxury for intimate destination weddings.
longDescription:
RAAS Jodhpur represents the perfect marriage of heritage and contemporary design, a boutique luxury hotel that has redefined intimate destination weddings in the Blue City. Nestled within the ancient walls of Jodhpur's walled city, directly beneath the imposing Mehrangarh Fort, RAAS offers couples a wedding experience that is simultaneously deeply rooted in Rajasthani tradition and refreshingly modern in its execution. This is not merely a hotel; it is a carefully curated collection of 18th-century havelis transformed into an architectural masterpiece.

The property's design philosophy celebrates the raw beauty of Jodhpur's traditional architecture while introducing clean contemporary lines and luxurious modern amenities. Red sandstone walls, restored wooden doorways, traditional lime plaster, and indigenous stone work create an atmosphere of timeless elegance. The 78 rooms and suites are spread across restored havelis, each offering unique layouts, private sit-outs, and spectacular views of either the fort or the blue-washed houses of the old city.

Wedding celebrations at RAAS unfold across intimate yet impressive venues. The Baradari, a stunning open-air pavilion, can seat 150 guests for ceremonies with the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort as a natural backdrop. The Step Garden, with its cascading levels and water features, provides a romantic setting for sangeet and cocktail evenings. The Darikhana, the restored haveli's original living room, offers an intimate space for mehendi ceremonies and smaller gatherings. For truly spectacular experiences, RAAS can arrange exclusive access to terraces with unobstructed fort views, perfect for golden-hour ceremonies as the sun sets behind the ancient citadel.

The culinary program at RAAS celebrates the diverse flavors of Marwar, presenting traditional Jodhpuri dishes alongside modern interpretations of Indian cuisine. The kitchen team sources ingredients from local farms and specialty producers, creating menus that tell the story of the region's rich culinary heritage. From mirchi vada and mawa kachori at the mehendi to elaborate multi-course wedding feasts featuring safed maas and govind gatta, every meal becomes a celebration of Rajasthani gastronomy.

What distinguishes RAAS for intimate weddings is its boutique scale combined with world-class service. Unlike larger properties where weddings can feel like one of many events, RAAS offers personalized attention that makes every celebration feel exclusive. The dedicated wedding team works closely with couples to craft bespoke experiences, from arranging traditional musicians from the Langa and Manganiyar communities to organizing shopping excursions in Jodhpur's famous markets, from coordinating elaborate mehendi artists to managing complex multi-day celebration logistics.

The location itself becomes part of the wedding experience. Guests staying at RAAS can explore the labyrinthine streets of the Blue City, visit the magnificent Mehrangarh Fort Museum, shop for handicrafts and textiles in the bustling bazaars, and discover the hidden temples and step-wells that dot the old city. For destination wedding guests, RAAS offers an immersive cultural experience that extends far beyond the wedding celebrations themselves.

faqs.question: Can the entire property be booked exclusively?
faqs.answer: Yes, full property buyouts are available and recommended for weddings. This ensures complete privacy and allows all 78 rooms to accommodate your wedding guests. Buyout rates vary by season and duration.

faqs.question: What are the venue options for ceremonies?
faqs.answer: The Baradari is ideal for main ceremonies with Mehrangarh Fort as backdrop. The Step Garden suits sangeet and cocktails. Darikhana works for mehendi. Fort View Terrace offers sunset ceremonies. Each space can be decorated to your theme.

faqs.question: How does the location affect wedding logistics?
faqs.answer: The old city location requires some planning. Larger vehicles must park at designated areas with transfers arranged. The hotel's wedding team expertly manages these logistics. The unique atmosphere and views make the extra coordination worthwhile.

faqs.question: What cultural experiences can be arranged for guests?
faqs.answer: RAAS specializes in curated experiences including Mehrangarh Fort tours, Blue City walking tours, Langa-Manganiyar music performances, textile and handicraft shopping expeditions, cooking classes, and zip-lining from the fort for adventurous guests.

faqs.question: Is outside catering available?
faqs.answer: RAAS's celebrated culinary team handles all catering with expertise in Marwari and contemporary cuisines. The farm-to-table approach and local sourcing create exceptional dining. Special family recipes can be incorporated with advance discussion.

faqs.question: What photography opportunities does the location offer?
faqs.answer: The Mehrangarh Fort backdrop is iconic for wedding photography. Blue-washed houses of the old city, the step-well, traditional havelis, and rooftop views all provide stunning settings. Golden hour photography here is particularly magical.

faqs.question: What are the music timing restrictions?
faqs.answer: Outdoor venues follow local regulations with music until 10:00 PM. Indoor spaces allow music until 11:00 PM. Traditional folk performances are highly encouraged and can continue longer in designated areas with appropriate volume.

faqs.question: How many guests can the property accommodate?
faqs.answer: RAAS has 78 rooms accommodating approximately 150 guests. For larger weddings, partner properties in Jodhpur can be arranged with shuttle services. The intimate scale ensures every guest receives personalized attention.

faqs.question: What backup options exist for weather issues?
faqs.answer: The Darikhana indoor venue seats 60 guests and can be expanded with adjoining spaces. Covered terraces and canopy setups provide shelter while maintaining the atmosphere. The wedding team monitors weather and coordinates alternatives proactively.

name: Fairmont Jaipur
shortDescription: Celebrate grand Indian weddings at Fairmont Jaipur, a magnificent Mughal palace-inspired resort offering expansive venues, luxury accommodation, and world-class hospitality for celebrations up to 2,500 guests.
longDescription:
Fairmont Jaipur stands as the Pink City's most impressive modern palace, a sprawling 20-acre resort that captures the grandeur of Mughal architecture while delivering 21st-century luxury. Designed to host the most ambitious celebrations, this magnificent property has quickly become Jaipur's premier venue for large-scale destination weddings, offering couples the rare combination of palatial venues, extensive accommodation, and the legendary service for which the Fairmont brand is renowned worldwide.

The resort's architecture draws inspiration from the great Mughal palaces, featuring soaring domes, intricate marble inlay work, reflective pools, and meticulously manicured Char Bagh gardens. Every vista within the property offers photo-worthy moments, from the grand porte-cochère entrance to the stunning central courtyard with its cascading fountain. The scale is deliberately impressive—this is a venue designed to accommodate the grandest of Indian wedding celebrations without sacrificing intimacy or elegance.

With 245 luxuriously appointed rooms and suites, Fairmont Jaipur can accommodate up to 500 wedding guests on-property, eliminating the logistical challenges of coordinating multiple hotels for large celebrations. Each room reflects the resort's design philosophy, combining Rajasthani artistic traditions with contemporary luxury. The Grand Presidential Suite, spanning over 4,200 square feet, offers the ultimate bridal preparation space, complete with private gardens and panoramic resort views.

Wedding venues at Fairmont Jaipur range from intimate garden pavilions to the magnificent Grand Lawn capable of hosting 2,500 guests. The Udyan Courtyard provides a romantic setting for ceremonies with its lotus pools and marble pavilions. The Grand Ballroom, at 10,000 square feet, offers climate-controlled elegance for receptions and sangeet celebrations. For couples seeking outdoor celebrations, the resort's multiple lawns can be configured for any event scale, from intimate cocktail gatherings to elaborate baraat processions.

The culinary team at Fairmont Jaipur brings expertise in crafting elaborate wedding feasts that honor Indian traditions while showcasing global culinary techniques. From traditional Rajasthani thalis featuring dal baati churma and laal maas to contemporary Indo-fusion tasting menus, every meal is executed with precision. The resort's specialty dining venues, including the award-winning Zarin for Indian cuisine and Venetia for Italian fare, can host intimate family dinners, while the extensive banqueting operation seamlessly serves thousands.

Fairmont's wedding planning services are comprehensive, with dedicated teams handling everything from vendor coordination and décor management to guest logistics and entertainment programming. The resort maintains relationships with Jaipur's finest decorators, musicians, and performers, ensuring access to the best talent. For families seeking traditional elements, Fairmont can arrange everything from elaborate baraat processions with bands, horses, and elephants to classical dance performances and fireworks displays.

The resort's extensive facilities ensure wedding guests remain entertained throughout multi-day celebrations. The Willow Stream Spa offers traditional and contemporary treatments for pre-wedding pampering. The fitness center and yoga pavilion cater to health-conscious guests. Multiple pools, including a stunning infinity pool, provide relaxation between events. name: Samode Palace
shortDescription: Step into a fairytale at Samode Palace, a 475-year-old royal residence nestled in the Aravalli hills, offering authentic Rajputana grandeur with hand-painted murals, mirrored halls, and timeless romantic charm.
longDescription:
Samode Palace is not merely a wedding venue—it is a living museum of Rajputana artistry and royal heritage that has witnessed over four centuries of celebrations, romances, and family traditions. This magnificent 475-year-old palace, still owned and operated by the Samode royal family, offers couples the rare opportunity to celebrate their union in an authentic historic setting that no modern construction can replicate. For those seeking a wedding that feels like stepping into a bygone era of maharajas and royal ceremonies, Samode Palace delivers an experience of unparalleled authenticity.

The palace's artistic heritage is immediately evident upon entering its gates. Every surface tells a story through elaborate hand-painted murals depicting royal hunts, celestial beings, and geometric patterns executed in the distinctive Samode style that blends Mughal and Rajput artistic traditions. The famed Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace) dazzles visitors with thousands of tiny mirrors embedded in intricate patterns, creating a kaleidoscope of reflected candlelight during evening celebrations. The Durbar Hall, with its original painted walls and royal seating, provides a ceremonial space that requires no decoration—its beauty is complete.

Wedding celebrations at Samode Palace unfold across a tapestry of romantic venues, each with its own character and charm. The sprawling palace lawns, surrounded by historic walls and backed by the Aravalli hills, accommodate ceremonies for up to 300 guests. The stepped garden, with its fountains and terraced levels, creates a dramatic setting for sangeet celebrations. The palace courtyards, intimate and enclosed by painted archways, host mehendi ceremonies bathed in natural light. For evening receptions, the Sheesh Mahal and Durbar Hall provide indoor grandeur that photographs beautifully in candlelight.

The 43 rooms and suites within the palace maintain their historic character while offering modern comforts. Each room features original artwork, antique furniture, and unique architectural details—no two rooms are alike. The royal suites occupy the palace's most significant chambers, offering carved marble bathrooms, private terraces, and views over the gardens and hills. Staying at Samode Palace means living as royalty did, surrounded by history and art at every turn.

Culinary experiences at Samode Palace celebrate the rich traditions of Rajasthani cuisine alongside refined continental options. The palace kitchen has served generations of the royal family and their guests, maintaining recipes passed down through centuries while adapting to contemporary tastes. Wedding feasts can include everything from elaborate Rajasthani thalis served on silver thalis to European-style courses. The palace can arrange intimate dinners in the gardens, group dining in historic halls, or elaborate outdoor feasts under the stars.

What makes Samode Palace truly special for weddings is its authenticity. The family's ongoing involvement ensures that celebrations honor both the venue's heritage and the significance of the wedding occasion. Traditional ceremonies are conducted with genuine understanding of their meaning, not merely as performance. The palace's relative seclusion—just 45 kilometers from Jaipur—provides privacy and tranquility impossible to find in city venues, while remaining accessible for guests arriving from near and far.
weatherNote: Samode enjoys pleasant weather from October to March with temperatures between 8°C to 26°C. The hillside location provides natural cooling. Winter evenings can be cool, requiring heating for outdoor events.

faqs.answer: The Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace) is adorned with thousands of tiny mirrors in intricate patterns. When lit with candles or soft lighting, it creates magical reflections ideal for intimate ceremonies, cocktails, or couple photography sessions.

faqs.answer: Activities include village walks, camel rides, cooking classes, henna sessions, turban-tying demonstrations, local craft shopping, bird watching, and excursions to Jaipur attractions. The palace curates authentic rural Rajasthan experiences.

faqs.question: Can specific ceremonies be conducted in traditional style?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. The royal family and palace team have deep knowledge of Rajasthani wedding traditions. They can guide families through authentic ceremonies, arrange traditional priests, and ensure rituals are conducted properly.

faqs.question: What catering options are available?
faqs.answer: The palace kitchen specializes in royal Rajasthani cuisine with recipes preserved for generations. Continental options are also available. Outside caterers can be discussed for specific regional cuisines not offered in-house.

faqs.question: How does decoration work in a historic palace?
faqs.answer: The palace's original murals and architecture are the primary décor. Floral additions, fabric draping, and lighting enhance without competing. Decorators must follow guidelines protecting the historic surfaces. Less is often more here.

faqs.question: What is the weather contingency plan?
faqs.answer: The Durbar Hall and Sultan Mahal provide covered backup for outdoor events. The palace has extensive covered courtyards and verandahs. Tent structures can be arranged with advance planning. Winter weddings may require heating arrangements.

name: W Goa
shortDescription: Celebrate your love at W Goa, where vibrant energy meets Arabian Sea sunsets. This trendy beachfront resort delivers unforgettable destination weddings with contemporary luxury, bold design, and legendary W service.
longDescription:
W Goa breaks all conventions of traditional wedding venues, offering couples who dare to be different a celebration space that pulses with energy, creativity, and contemporary cool. Perched above the stunning Vagator Beach with commanding views of the Arabian Sea, this iconic property has become the destination of choice for modern couples seeking weddings that reflect their bold, sophisticated tastes. Here, sunset ceremonies unfold against an infinity of ocean blue, receptions groove to world-class DJs, and every moment is curated with the distinctive flair that defines the W brand.

The resort's design language speaks of Goan heritage reimagined through a contemporary lens. Portuguese architectural elements blend with vibrant modern aesthetics, creating spaces that feel simultaneously rooted and revolutionary. The signature W Living Room sets the tone with statement furniture, bold artwork, and floor-to-ceiling windows framing the sea. Throughout the property, unexpected design moments—suspended furniture installations, living walls, artist collaborations—provide Instagram-worthy backdrops that today's couples crave.

Wedding venues at W Goa offer variety for every celebration style. The Great Lawn, a 40,000 square foot oceanfront expanse, hosts grand ceremonies and receptions for up to 500 guests beneath Goa's legendary sunsets. The pool deck transforms into an ultra-stylish cocktail venue, with the infinity pool and sea creating seamless horizons. For intimate celebrations, the Rock Pool area offers a more secluded setting with direct beach access. Indoor celebrations shine in the Whatever/Whenever Ballroom, a flexible space that adapts to any vision.

The resort's 128 rooms and suites continue the design-forward aesthetic with beach-chic interiors, balconies or terraces, and the signature W beds ensuring guests rest between celebrations. The Marvelous Suites and Extreme WOW Suite offer expanded spaces for bridal parties and VIP guests, complete with outdoor bathtubs, private pools, and sweeping sea views that make getting ready as photogenic as the ceremony itself.

Culinary experiences at W Goa match the venue's bold personality. Spice Traders delivers contemporary Asian-Goan fusion, while Rock Pool serves seafood with views. The resort's mixology program elevates celebrations with creative cocktails and molecular bartending. For weddings, the culinary team creates custom menus blending Goan coastal traditions with global influences, presented with theatrical flair that transforms every meal into an event.

What truly distinguishes W Goa for weddings is the Whatever/Whenever philosophy—if you can dream it, the W team will make it happen. From arranging surprise performances by celebrated artists to coordinating sunrise after-parties on the beach, from creating custom cocktails that tell your love story to organizing boat arrivals via the Arabian Sea, W Goa delivers experiences that conventional venues cannot imagine. For couples seeking a wedding that celebrates their individuality with unapologetic style, W Goa is the ultimate stage.

name: Park Hyatt Goa Resort and Spa
shortDescription: Experience refined elegance at Park Hyatt Goa, a sprawling 45-acre beachfront paradise on South Goa's pristine Arossim Beach, offering intimate luxury and world-class hospitality for unforgettable destination weddings.
longDescription:
Park Hyatt Goa Resort and Spa represents the pinnacle of refined beachfront luxury, a meticulously designed 45-acre paradise that seamlessly blends Portuguese colonial elegance with contemporary sophistication. Set along the pristine Arossim Beach in South Goa's quieter shores, this award-winning resort offers couples a wedding destination that prioritizes serenity, intimacy, and impeccable service over the bustle of North Goa's party scene. For those seeking a beach wedding with understated elegance and genuine tranquility, Park Hyatt Goa delivers an experience of uncommon refinement.

The resort's architecture pays graceful homage to Goa's Indo-Portuguese heritage, with whitewashed buildings featuring traditional balcaos, terracotta roofs, and vibrant bougainvillea cascading over shaded verandahs. The design philosophy emphasizes horizontal space and natural integration, with no building rising above the surrounding palm canopy. Meandering pathways connect intimate courtyards, lotus ponds, and tropical gardens, creating a village-like atmosphere where every turn reveals new beauty.

With 250 spacious rooms, suites, and villas, Park Hyatt Goa can accommodate wedding celebrations of significant scale while maintaining the intimate atmosphere that defines the property. The Pousada-style architecture arranges accommodation in small clusters, each with private gardens and distinct character. The ultra-luxurious Park Villas offer private pools and direct beach access, ideal for the couple and VIP guests seeking exceptional privacy.

Wedding venues at Park Hyatt Goa span beach, lawn, and interior spaces with remarkable versatility. The central courtyard, surrounded by colonial arcades and illuminated by fairy lights, creates magical settings for ceremonies and dinners. name: ITC Grand Goa, a Luxury Collection Resort
shortDescription: Celebrate magnificence at ITC Grand Goa, a spectacular 45-acre Goan village resort on pristine Arossim Beach, offering grandest wedding venues, legendary ITC hospitality, and exquisite culinary excellence.
longDescription:
ITC Grand Goa stands as South Goa's most magnificent celebration destination, a 45-acre paradise that reimagines the traditional Goan village as a canvas for the grandest wedding celebrations. Part of Marriott's prestigious Luxury Collection, this award-winning resort combines ITC's legendary Indian hospitality with international luxury standards, creating a destination where couples can host celebrations of extraordinary scale without sacrificing intimacy, authenticity, or service excellence.

The resort's design philosophy draws deeply from Goan architectural heritage, recreating the charm of a traditional waterfront village complete with cobblestone pathways, Portuguese-style balcaos, terracotta roofs, and churches that anchor the property's visual identity. Sixteen interconnected waterways and cascading water bodies create a Venice-like atmosphere, with intimate bridges connecting different zones of the property. The effect is magical—a place where modernity serves tradition rather than replacing it.

With 252 rooms and suites arranged in villa-style clusters, ITC Grand Goa can accommodate wedding parties of significant scale while maintaining the intimate village atmosphere. The rooms reflect Goan heritage with four-poster beds, traditional furniture, and private balconies overlooking waterways or gardens. The Presidential Suites and Manor Suite offer exceptional luxury for the couple and VIP family members.

Wedding venues at ITC Grand Goa achieve scales unmatched by most beach properties. The Grand Lawn, an expansive 75,000 square foot oceanfront venue, can host celebrations for up to 1,500 guests—making it ideal for the grandest Indian wedding celebrations. The indoor Grand Ballroom offers 12,000 square feet of climate-controlled elegance. Multiple waterfront venues, courtyards, and intimate gardens provide options for every event type, from mehendi gatherings to grand receptions.

ITC's culinary reputation reaches its zenith at Grand Goa. The resort features multiple specialty restaurants, including the acclaimed Peshawri for Northwest Frontier cuisine, Tempero for Mediterranean fare, and specialty Goan restaurants showcasing coastal traditions. For weddings, the legendary ITC culinary team creates bespoke menus that can feature anything from elaborate Rajasthani thalis to seven-course continental dinners, executed with precision at scales few hotels can manage.

The Kaya Kalp Royal Spa, one of India's most awarded wellness destinations, provides comprehensive pre-wedding services from traditional Ayurvedic treatments to contemporary beauty services. For wedding guests, the resort offers exceptional recreation including swimming pools, water sports, fitness center, and curated cultural experiences that showcase Goa's unique heritage.

name: Taj Malabar Resort & Spa
shortDescription: Experience waterfront elegance at Taj Malabar Cochin, a historic heritage hotel overlooking the Arabian Sea and Cochin harbour, where colonial charm meets tropical luxury for unforgettable destination weddings.
longDescription:
Taj Malabar Resort & Spa occupies one of the most enchanting locations in all of India—the tip of Willingdon Island overlooking where the backwaters meet the Arabian Sea. This storied property, dating to 1935, has witnessed countless celebrations of love, hosting royalty, dignitaries, and discerning couples who recognize that few places on earth offer such a perfect confluence of history, natural beauty, and sophisticated hospitality. For destination weddings that seek to capture the mystical allure of Kerala, Taj Malabar delivers an experience both intimate and unforgettable.

The resort's architecture tells the story of Cochin's cosmopolitan heritage, blending Dutch, Portuguese, British, and indigenous Kerala influences into a cohesive colonial elegance. The historic Tower Wing, dating to the original 1935 construction, offers suites that have hosted generations of distinguished guests. The contemporary Malabar Wing extends into the harbour with rooms featuring private balconies overlooking the sea. Throughout the property, antique furniture, period photographs, and traditional craft work create an atmosphere of gracious living from another era.

Wedding venues at Taj Malabar maximize the spectacular waterfront setting. The Harbour Lawn, stretching along the water's edge, hosts ceremonies and receptions for up to 400 guests with the harbour's Chinese fishing nets and passing ships creating an ever-changing backdrop. The Poolside Terrace offers a more intimate setting for sangeet and cocktail celebrations. For indoor elegance, the ballroom provides climate-controlled comfort with harbour views. The resort can also arrange celebrations on the private pier, with the couple arriving by traditional Kettuvallam houseboat.

Culinary traditions at Taj Malabar celebrate Kerala's extraordinary food heritage. The Pepper & Rice restaurant showcases the coastal state's famous seafood preparations and vegetarian delicacies. The resort's chefs source ingredients from local spice plantations and fishing communities, creating menus that tell the story of the Spice Coast. For weddings, the culinary team crafts bespoke menus blending Kerala Sadhya traditions with continental sophistication, served in the elaborate style befitting the venue's heritage.

The Jiva Spa provides pre-wedding wellness rooted in Kerala's legendary Ayurvedic traditions. From traditional Abhyanga massages to bride and groom preparation rituals, the spa team draws on centuries of holistic healing knowledge. Wedding guests can also explore Cochin's remarkable cultural treasures, from the ancient synagogue and Portuguese palace in Jew Town to the Chinese fishing nets of Fort Kochi, all within minutes of the resort.

What distinguishes Taj Malabar for destination weddings is its ability to immerse guests in Kerala's unique culture while maintaining the gracious service standards for which Taj is renowned worldwide. The wedding planning team crafts celebrations that honor local traditions—from Thali ceremonies to traditional percussion performances—while incorporating the couple's personal vision.

name: The Leela Kovalam, A Raviz Hotel
shortDescription: Perched on a dramatic cliff overlooking the Arabian Sea, The Leela Kovalam offers breathtaking sunset ceremonies, pristine private beaches, and Kerala's legendary hospitality for unforgettable destination weddings.
longDescription:
The Leela Kovalam commands one of India's most spectacular coastal positions—a dramatic cliff-top perch overlooking the iconic Kovalam Beach and the endless expanse of the Arabian Sea. This legendary resort has defined luxury beach tourism in Kerala since its opening, offering couples a destination wedding venue where every sunset feels like a divine blessing and every moment carries the whisper of the waves below. For those seeking beach wedding magic with a touch of theatrical drama, The Leela Kovalam delivers an experience that photographs beautifully and lives forever in memory.

The resort's architecture harmonizes with its stunning natural setting, with low-rise buildings cascading down the cliff face through tropical gardens. Traditional Kerala architectural elements—sloping tiled roofs, wooden verandahs, and open-air courtyards—blend with contemporary luxury amenities. The property's multiple levels create intimate zones and dramatic viewpoints, with every corner revealing new perspectives of the azure sea below.

With 183 rooms and suites spread across the cliff-side property, The Leela Kovalam accommodates substantial wedding parties while maintaining the intimate resort atmosphere that defines the property's charm. The Beach Villas offer direct sand access for couples seeking ultimate privacy. The Cliff Suites provide panoramic ocean views from private balconies. Throughout the accommodation, the design celebrates Kerala's craft traditions with contemporary comfort.

Wedding venues at The Leela Kovalam leverage the extraordinary setting with creativity. The Beach Lawn, stretching along the private beach below the cliff, hosts ceremonies for up to 500 guests with the sea as witness. The Cliff-Top Lawn offers a more elevated perspective, with sunset ceremonies unfolding as the sun dips into the Arabian Sea. The open-air Tides restaurant terrace becomes a romantic dinner venue. Indoor celebrations are hosted in the elegant ballroom with floor-to-ceiling windows framing ocean views.

The culinary program celebrates Kerala's extraordinary food traditions with particular emphasis on the state's famous seafood preparations. Fresh catch from local fishermen, spices from nearby plantations, and family recipes passed down through generations combine in menus that tell the story of God's Own Country. The resort's restaurants—The Terrace for all-day dining, Sky Grill for oceanside barbecue, and the specialty outlets—provide diverse dining experiences for multi-day wedding celebrations.

Divya Spa draws on Kerala's millennia-old Ayurvedic healing traditions, offering treatments that prepare the body and mind for life's significant transitions. From traditional Panchakarma purification to modern beauty services, the spa team creates comprehensive pre-wedding wellness programs. Wedding guests can also explore Kerala's cultural treasures, from Padmanabhaswamy Temple in nearby Trivandrum to the historic lighthouse and fishing villages of Kovalam.
