name: The Lodhi, New Delhi
shortDescription: Experience ultra-exclusive celebrations at The Lodhi, Delhi's only all-suite luxury hotel where every wedding becomes a private affair with personalized service, contemporary elegance, and unmatched sophistication.
longDescription:
The Lodhi represents the absolute pinnacle of luxury hospitality in India's capital—an ultra-exclusive address where the concept of personalized service reaches unprecedented levels. As Delhi's only hotel where every accommodation is a suite, each featuring a private pool or garden, The Lodhi offers couples who accept nothing less than exceptional an opportunity to host celebrations that redefine wedding luxury. This is not a venue for crowds or conventional celebrations; this is for those who seek intimacy elevated to an art form.

The property's aesthetic draws from India's rich artistic heritage, reimagined through a contemporary lens. Curated art collections featuring works by celebrated Indian artists adorn public spaces and suites alike. The architecture favors clean lines, natural materials, and thoughtful integration of indoor and outdoor living. Gardens spread across the property create serene pockets of greenery unusual in urban Delhi, while the signature private plunge pools offer guests unprecedented privacy and luxury.

With only 40 suites, The Lodhi provides an exclusivity that larger properties simply cannot match. Each suite spans a minimum of 1,076 square feet, with the Premier and Lodhi Suites offering even more expansive living spaces. Private gardens, plunge pools, and dedicated butler service ensure that the wedding couple and their closest family members experience accommodation that rivals private residences.

Wedding venues at The Lodhi prioritize quality over quantity. The manicured lawns provide an intimate outdoor setting for up to 350 guests, framed by mature trees and exquisite landscaping. The sophisticated indoor venues offer climate-controlled elegance for receptions and sangeet celebrations. Private dining rooms host intimate family gatherings, while the pool terrace can be configured for cocktail evenings. The exclusivity means that when you book The Lodhi for a wedding, the celebration commands the property's full attention.

Culinary experiences at The Lodhi reflect the property's commitment to excellence without compromise. Elan, the award-winning restaurant, and Indian Accent, consistently ranked among Asia's best, represent the depth of culinary talent at the couple's disposal. Wedding menus can draw from this expertise, creating bespoke dining experiences that match the occasion's significance. The culinary team specializes in intimate, plated dinners as well as elegant buffet presentations.

The service philosophy at The Lodhi centers on anticipation and personalization. The wedding team works closely with couples over extended planning periods, understanding preferences, family dynamics, and vision in detail rarely possible at larger venues. Every staff member knows wedding guests by name. Every request receives individual attention. For couples who value service perfection over grand scale, The Lodhi delivers an experience without parallel.

name: ITC Maurya, New Delhi
shortDescription: Celebrate grandeur at ITC Maurya, Delhi's iconic luxury address housing the legendary Bukhara restaurant, offering unmatched culinary excellence, expansive venues, and ITC's signature hospitality for magnificent weddings.
longDescription:
ITC Maurya has defined luxury hospitality in India's capital for over four decades, establishing itself as the preferred address for world leaders, celebrities, and discerning families celebrating life's most significant moments. Home to the legendary Bukhara—consistently ranked among the world's best restaurants—and multiple award-winning dining venues, ITC Maurya offers wedding couples access to culinary excellence unmatched by any hotel in the country. For families seeking grand celebrations that honor tradition with exceptional quality, ITC Maurya remains Delhi's gold standard.

The hotel's architecture makes a bold statement, with the distinctive pyramid structure and grand atrium lobby creating an immediate impression of scale and ambition. The interiors showcase ITC's signature aesthetic, blending traditional Indian craftsmanship with contemporary luxury. Art collections featuring works by celebrated Indian masters adorn public spaces and function areas, while the extensive use of marble, brass, and rich textiles creates an atmosphere of timeless elegance.

With 438 rooms and suites, ITC Maurya accommodates wedding parties of substantial scale. The accommodation ranges from well-appointed Deluxe rooms to the magnificent Presidential Suite, offering options for every requirement. The Towers floors provide enhanced luxury with exclusive lounge access, while the ITC One experiences cater to the most discerning guests. The property's size allows entire wedding parties to stay on-site, simplifying logistics for multi-day celebrations.

Wedding venues at ITC Maurya span intimate gatherings to celebrations of extraordinary scale. The magnificent Peacock Hall, one of Delhi's largest hotel ballrooms at over 20,000 square feet, accommodates receptions for 1,500 guests. The outdoor Peacock Lawns provide manicured green spaces for ceremonies. Multiple smaller venues—including the elegant Kautilya and refined Maya—host sangeet, mehendi, and intimate dinners. The venue configuration allows complete multi-day weddings to unfold on-site with variety and flow.

The culinary program at ITC Maurya is legendary. Bukhara has served its iconic dal and sikandari raan to generations of dignitaries and food lovers. Dum Pukht presents the refined flavors of Awadhi cuisine. West View offers contemporary international fare. The wedding culinary team draws from this extraordinary expertise, creating menus that become talking points long after celebrations conclude. Few wedding venues can offer this depth of culinary mastery at scale.

Kaya Kalp—The Royal Spa provides comprehensive pre-wedding wellness, from Ayurvedic treatments to contemporary beauty services. The wedding planning team brings decades of institutional knowledge, having orchestrated celebrations for India's most prominent families. This experience translates into flawless execution, with ITC's signature attention to detail evident in every interaction.

name: The Taj Mahal Palace, Mumbai
shortDescription: Celebrate at India's most iconic hotel—The Taj Mahal Palace Mumbai. This legendary 1903 heritage landmark overlooking the Gateway of India offers unmatched prestige, history, and Taj hospitality for extraordinary weddings.
longDescription:
The Taj Mahal Palace is more than a hotel—it is an institution that has shaped India's hospitality industry for over 120 years. Rising majestically beside the Gateway of India on Mumbai's iconic waterfront, this legendary property represents the pinnacle of Indian hospitality, a place where generations of royalty, world leaders, celebrities, and prominent families have celebrated life's most significant moments. For couples seeking a wedding venue that carries the weight of history and the prestige of an unmatched legacy, The Taj Mahal Palace stands alone.

The hotel's architecture is immediately recognizable, a stunning fusion of Moorish, Oriental, and Florentine styles that has defined Mumbai's skyline since 1903. The original Palace Wing, with its soaring dome, ornate interiors, and hand-woven carpets, transports guests to an era of unbridled elegance. The Tower Wing adds contemporary luxury while maintaining the property's refined character. Throughout both wings, museum-quality antiques, crystal chandeliers, and original artwork create an atmosphere of living history.

With 285 rooms and suites across the Palace and Tower wings, The Taj Mahal Palace accommodates wedding parties in surroundings that befit the occasion's significance. The Palace Wing's heritage rooms feature antique furniture, high ceilings, and original architectural details. The Grande Presidential Suite, spanning 4,840 square feet with bay views, offers the ultimate bridal preparation space. Every room tells a story, carrying guests into the grand narrative of India's most celebrated hotel.

Wedding venues at The Taj Mahal Palace combine history with capability. The Crystal Room, with its original Belgian crystal chandeliers and ornate ceiling, hosts elegant receptions for up to 300 guests. The Ballroom accommodates larger celebrations while maintaining the property's sophisticated atmosphere. The Sea Lounge terrace offers intimate gatherings with Gateway views. For truly exceptional moments, the hotel can arrange exclusive use of spaces that have hosted coronations and state dinners.

The wedding culinary team draws from this extraordinary expertise, creating menus that honor the property's tradition of gastronomic excellence. name: The St. Regis Mumbai
shortDescription: Soar above Mumbai at The St. Regis, an ultra-modern skyscraper offering dramatic city views, expansive ballrooms, legendary St. Regis Butler Service, and sophisticated glamour for spectacular destination weddings.
longDescription:
The St. Regis Mumbai represents the pinnacle of contemporary luxury hospitality, a soaring skyscraper that has redefined sophistication in India's financial capital. Rising above Lower Parel's dynamic cityscape, this landmark property offers couples who embrace modernity and grandeur a wedding venue that matches their ambitions. Here, celebrations unfold against floor-to-ceiling windows framing Mumbai's glittering skyline, with service delivered by the legendary St. Regis Butler tradition that has defined luxury hospitality for over a century.

The hotel's design celebrates bold contemporary aesthetics with spaces that feel simultaneously intimate and dramatic. Art installations by celebrated contemporary artists punctuate public areas. The signature St. Regis Bar recreates the sophisticated atmosphere of the original New York location. Throughout the property, careful attention to materials, lighting, and spatial flow creates an atmosphere of refined modernity that photographs beautifully and impresses discerning guests.

With 395 rooms and suites occupying the upper floors of the tower, The St. Regis Mumbai offers wedding parties accommodation with views that extend to the Arabian Sea. Every room features floor-to-ceiling windows, luxurious marble bathrooms, and the signature St. Regis Butler Service. The Presidential Suite and Bentley Suite offer expansive living spaces for the couple and VIP guests, with private butler attention throughout the stay.

Wedding venues at The St. Regis Mumbai achieve impressive scale while maintaining sophistication. The Grand Ballroom, spanning 8,500 square feet with 23-foot ceilings, accommodates receptions for up to 1,000 guests in pillarless grandeur. Pre-function areas and foyers allow seamless event flow. Multiple smaller venues host sangeet, mehendi, and intimate celebrations. The rooftop venue offers al fresco celebrations with spectacular city views. The flexibility of venues allows complete multi-day weddings on-site.

Culinary experiences at The St. Regis draw from both global expertise and local talent. Yuuka offers Japanese fine dining, while By the Mekong presents Pan-Asian flavors. The Seven Kitchens all-day dining showcases diverse cuisines. Butlers anticipate needs, manage logistics, and ensure that the couple and key guests experience seamless, personalized service throughout the celebration. For couples seeking a wedding venue that combines contemporary glamour with legendary service traditions, The St. Regis Mumbai delivers exceptionally.

name: Taj Falaknuma Palace, Hyderabad
shortDescription: Reign over your wedding at Taj Falaknuma Palace, the magnificent former residence of the Nizam of Hyderabad perched 2000 feet above the city, offering authentic Nizami grandeur and unparalleled romantic opulence.
longDescription:
Taj Falaknuma Palace is quite simply India's most romantic palace hotel—a magnificent 19th-century scorpion-shaped palace that once served as the residence of the Nizam of Hyderabad, the world's wealthiest man of his era. Perched 2,000 feet above the city on a plateau with commanding views of Hyderabad's ancient quarters, this extraordinary property offers couples the rare opportunity to celebrate their union in surroundings of genuine royal splendor. Here, every wedding becomes a page from a fairy tale, set against the backdrop of one of India's most opulent private residences.

The palace's architecture and interiors represent the zenith of 19th-century aristocratic luxury. Venetian chandeliers, some weighing over a ton, illuminate grand halls. The world's largest dining table seats 101 guests beneath hand-painted ceilings. Rare antiques, including chairs that once belonged to Louis XIV and Ming vases, furnish royal chambers. The jade collection rivals museum holdings. Throughout the palace, the extravagance speaks of an era when wealth knew no bounds and craftsmanship reached artistic heights.

With only 60 rooms and suites, Taj Falaknuma Palace offers exclusivity that larger properties cannot match. Each accommodation occupies original palace quarters, with suites spanning multiple rooms filled with antique furniture and original artwork. The Nizam Suites offer the ultimate in royal accommodation, with private butler service and access to palace treasures. Staying at Falaknuma means living as the Nizam's guests once did, surrounded by authentic opulence at every turn.

Wedding venues at Taj Falaknuma Palace leverage the spectacular architecture and grounds. The palace lawns, with the city spread below, host ceremonies for up to 350 guests beneath historic stone walls and ancient trees. The Durbar Hall, with its original chandeliers and royal portraits, provides an indoor setting of incomparable grandeur. The Jade Room and Mirror Room offer intimate spaces for ceremonies and family gatherings. The terraces provide romantic settings for sunset cocktails and twilight celebrations.

Culinary experiences at Falaknuma draw from the legendary kitchens of the Nizams. The palace's restaurants present both authentic Hyderabadi cuisine—including the original Nizam recipes—and refined continental fare. The famous Falaknuma biryani, prepared with centuries-old techniques, anchors wedding feasts. The 101-seat dining table can be reserved for extraordinary dinner experiences. The culinary team creates menus that honor the palace's heritage while accommodating contemporary preferences.

The approach to Falaknuma itself becomes part of the wedding experience. Guests arrive in vintage horse-drawn carriages, ascending the winding road to the palace gates. The butler service, modeled on the Nizam's household traditions, attends to every need with practiced discretion. For couples seeking a wedding venue where history, romance, and genuine aristocratic splendor converge, Taj Falaknuma Palace remains unequaled anywhere in the world.

The palace's design draws inspiration from the legendary Mysore Palace, with domes, ornate pillars, and intricate detailing that transport guests to an era of royal grandeur. Yet the property seamlessly integrates modern amenities and technology, reflecting Bengaluru's position as India's innovation hub. Art collections featuring works by celebrated Indian masters adorn public spaces, while the interiors showcase a thoughtful blend of traditional craftsmanship and contemporary comfort.

With 357 rooms and suites, The Leela Palace Bengaluru accommodates wedding parties of significant scale while maintaining the personalized attention that defines Leela hospitality. The Royal Club floors offer enhanced luxury with exclusive lounge access and dedicated butler service. The Presidential Suite and Royal Suites provide expansive living spaces for the wedding couple and VIP guests, with private terraces overlooking the landscaped gardens.

Wedding venues at The Leela Palace Bengaluru achieve impressive versatility. The Grand Ballroom, one of the largest in Bengaluru, accommodates receptions for up to 1,000 guests with its pillarless design and high ceilings. The sprawling gardens and lawns provide romantic outdoor settings for ceremonies and cultural celebrations. Multiple smaller venues—including the elegant Jamavar and refined Le Cirque—host intimate gatherings, sangeet celebrations, and family dinners. name: The Oberoi Amarvilas, Agra
shortDescription: Exchange vows with the Taj Mahal as your witness at The Oberoi Amarvilas, the only hotel offering unobstructed views of the world's greatest monument to love, creating truly poetic destination weddings.
longDescription:
The Oberoi Amarvilas occupies what might be the most romantic hotel location on earth—just 600 meters from the Taj Mahal, with every room offering unobstructed views of this eternal monument to love. For couples seeking a wedding venue where the very setting speaks of devotion and romance, Amarvilas creates an experience that no other property in the world can match. Here, ceremonies unfold with the Taj Mahal's silhouette marking the horizon, and receptions take place beneath starlit skies with the marble dome glowing in the moonlight.

The resort's architecture pays homage to Mughal traditions, with terraced lawns, fountains, reflection pools, and pavilions that echo the gardens surrounding the Taj Mahal itself. The interiors blend classical Mughal motifs with contemporary luxury, creating spaces that feel both timeless and comfortable. Throughout the property, the design ensures that the Taj Mahal remains in view, a constant reminder of why love is celebrated here.

With 102 rooms and suites, The Oberoi Amarvilas maintains the intimate scale that allows for truly personalized service. Every accommodation faces the Taj Mahal, with private terraces or gardens providing personal viewing spaces. The Kohinoor Suite offers the ultimate bridal experience, with its expansive living spaces and unrivaled Taj views. The attention to detail in room design reflects Oberoi's legendary commitment to guest comfort.

Wedding venues at Amarvilas leverage the extraordinary Taj Mahal views. The manicured lawns, spread across multiple levels, provide ceremony spaces with the monument as backdrop—a setting that needs no decoration. The pool terrace offers an intimate alternative with reflections of the Taj shimmering in the water. Indoor celebrations unfold in elegant venues with large windows framing the monument. The small scale ensures every wedding receives the property's complete attention.

Culinary excellence at Amarvilas draws from Mughlai traditions appropriate to the setting, alongside refined continental and Asian options. Bellevue restaurant offers all-day dining with Taj views, while Esphahan serves refined Indian cuisine. The wedding culinary team creates menus that honor the Mughal heritage while accommodating diverse palates. Outdoor dining beneath the stars, with the Taj Mahal glowing in the distance, creates unforgettable reception experiences.

The Oberoi Spa offers holistic wellness drawing from ancient Indian traditions, preparing couples for their special day with personalized treatment programs. The wedding planning team understands that every celebration here carries special significance—the Taj Mahal was built as the ultimate expression of love, and weddings at Amarvilas inherit that legacy. For couples who understand that some settings transcend ordinary beauty, The Oberoi Amarvilas offers a wedding experience of profound romantic significance.

name: Wildflower Hall, An Oberoi Resort
shortDescription: Escape to the clouds at Wildflower Hall Shimla, a magnificent Himalayan retreat set amid cedar forests at 8,250 feet, offering breathtaking mountain views and romantic seclusion for intimate destination weddings.
longDescription:
Wildflower Hall commands one of the most spectacular settings in the Himalayan range—a former residence of Lord Kitchener reimagined as an exquisite mountain resort, perched at 8,250 feet amid towering deodar cedars with panoramic views of snow-capped peaks. For couples seeking a destination wedding that combines natural grandeur with refined luxury, Wildflower Hall offers an escape from the ordinary into a realm of crisp mountain air, pristine forests, and horizons that stretch to forever. Here, weddings unfold against one of nature's most magnificent canvases.

The resort's architecture harmonizes with its alpine setting, featuring local stone, timber, and design elements that echo traditional Himalayan building styles while providing contemporary comfort. The interiors celebrate mountain living with warm wood paneling, stone fireplaces, and large windows framing the spectacular views. Throughout the property, the design philosophy respects the environment while creating spaces of understated elegance and natural luxury.

With only 85 rooms, suites, and residences, Wildflower Hall maintains the intimate atmosphere that defines exceptional mountain resorts. Each accommodation offers views of either the valley below or the snow-capped peaks beyond, with private balconies providing personal observation points for the ever-changing mountain scenery. The Lord Kitchener Suite and Oberoi Suite offer expansive living spaces for the wedding couple, with fireplaces and panoramic windows creating romantic retreats.

Wedding venues at Wildflower Hall leverage the extraordinary mountain setting. The terraced lawns, surrounded by ancient cedars and overlooking the valley, provide ceremony spaces with the Himalayas as backdrop. The indoor venues offer warm, elegant settings for winter celebrations when the mountains wear their snow blankets. The poolside terrace, heated for comfort, hosts cocktail gatherings with sunset views over the peaks. The flexibility of venues allows celebrations in any season.

Culinary experiences at Wildflower Hall celebrate mountain bounty and diverse traditions. The restaurant serves refined Indian and continental cuisine with ingredients sourced from local farms and the property's own gardens. For weddings, the culinary team creates menus that can range from elaborate North Indian celebrations to sophisticated multi-cuisine experiences, all prepared with the attention to detail that defines Oberoi hospitality.

The Oberoi Spa draws from Himalayan wellness traditions, offering treatments that incorporate local herbs and mountain influences. The wedding planning team understands the unique logistics of mountain celebrations, from weather contingencies to transportation coordination. For couples seeking a wedding venue where nature's grandeur becomes part of the celebration, Wildflower Hall provides an experience of profound beauty and romance.

name: ITC Grand Chola, Chennai
shortDescription: Experience South Indian grandeur at ITC Grand Chola Chennai, a magnificent architectural tribute to Chola dynasty splendor offering India's largest pillarless ballroom and unmatched capacity for grand celebrations.
longDescription:
ITC Grand Chola stands as a monumental tribute to Tamil Nadu's glorious Chola dynasty, translating ancient architectural magnificence into contemporary hospitality grandeur. This extraordinary property—one of the largest luxury hotels in India—offers couples planning grand celebrations a venue where scale meets sophistication in ways few properties anywhere can match. With India's largest pillarless ballroom and capacity for up to 3,000 guests, ITC Grand Chola has become the venue of choice for South India's most ambitious wedding celebrations.

The hotel's architecture draws inspiration from the Brihadisvara Temple at Thanjavur, one of the Chola dynasty's greatest architectural achievements. Soaring courtyards, intricate stone carvings, bronze sculptures, and design elements that echo millennium-old traditions create an atmosphere of timeless grandeur. Yet the property's infrastructure is thoroughly contemporary, with sophisticated technology and systems supporting events of extraordinary scale.

With 600 rooms and suites, ITC Grand Chola accommodates wedding parties that would challenge most properties. The accommodation spans from elegant deluxe rooms to the magnificent ITC One floor experiences offering personalized butler service. The Presidential Suite provides the ultimate bridal preparation space with its expansive layout and refined luxury. The sheer scale allows entire wedding parties—plus extended families—to stay on-site.

Wedding venues at ITC Grand Chola achieve scales unprecedented in Indian hospitality. The Rajendra Chola Hall, India's largest pillarless ballroom at 21,000 square feet, can accommodate receptions for 3,000 guests. The Convention Centre adds flexible configurations for varied event scales. The outdoor Chola Court provides elegant garden settings. Multiple smaller venues host intimate gatherings, sangeet celebrations, and family dinners. The venue versatility supports complete multi-day weddings of any scale.

Culinary excellence at ITC Grand Chola draws from legendary ITC expertise, with restaurants including Peshawri, Madras Pavilion, and Pan Asian specializing in distinct traditions. The wedding culinary team operates at a level few properties can approach, executing elaborate menus for thousands of guests without compromising quality. From traditional Tamil wedding feasts served on banana leaves to sophisticated multi-cuisine experiences, the capability is extraordinary.

Kaya Kalp Spa provides comprehensive wellness services, while the wedding planning team brings institutional experience managing South India's largest celebrations. For families planning weddings that honor tradition while embracing grand scale, ITC Grand Chola provides a venue where ambition finds no limitations.

name: Evolve Back, Coorg
shortDescription: Immerse in nature at Evolve Back Coorg, an exquisite eco-luxury plantation resort amid coffee estates and rainforest, offering intimate destination weddings with authentic Kodava heritage and sustainable luxury.
longDescription:
Evolve Back Coorg represents the pinnacle of sustainable luxury hospitality in India, a remarkable resort that seamlessly integrates with its coffee plantation setting while delivering experiences of uncommon refinement. Nestled in the misty hills of Kodagu amid 300 acres of organic coffee and spice estates, this property offers couples seeking intimate, nature-immersed weddings a destination where every moment connects with the earth's rhythms. Here, ceremonies unfold in sacred groves, receptions spill onto plantation grounds, and the fragrance of coffee blossoms perfumes celebrations.

The resort's architecture draws deeply from Kodava (Coorgi) traditions, featuring the distinctive ainmane (traditional homes) reimagined as luxury accommodations. Water bodies, lily ponds, and careful landscaping create transitions between the built environment and surrounding wilderness. Throughout the property, sustainable practices—from organic farming to rainwater harvesting—demonstrate that luxury and environmental responsibility coexist beautifully.

With 63 private pool villas, each inspired by traditional Kodava architecture, Evolve Back Coorg offers accommodation that celebrates the region's heritage. Every villa features a private pool, outdoor living spaces, and interiors crafted from sustainable materials. The Lily Pool Villas offer romantic settings for couples, while larger families spread across connecting villas. The sense of seclusion within the community creates ideal destination wedding atmospheres.

Wedding venues at Evolve Back leverage the extraordinary natural setting. The Ceremonial Ground, a sacred grove amid ancient trees, provides a spiritually resonant space for ceremonies. The Pavilion overlooks lily ponds for reception dinners. The coffee estate itself becomes a venue, with celebrations among the plantation rows. Indoor spaces provide weather backup while maintaining the organic atmosphere. The intimate scale means weddings never exceed 150 guests, ensuring personalization and exclusivity.

Culinary experiences celebrate the abundance of the estate, with restaurants featuring produce from organic gardens, spices from the plantation, and traditional Coorgi cuisine prepared with authentic recipes. The wedding culinary team creates menus that honor local traditions—including the famous Coorgi pork and rice wine—while accommodating diverse preferences. Farm-to-table dining here isn't a concept; it's the natural way of things.

The spa draws from local wellness traditions, incorporating estate-grown spices and herbs into treatments. Wedding guests can explore the estate through plantation walks, birdwatching, cooking classes, and visits to local villages. For couples seeking weddings that celebrate nature, heritage, and sustainability without compromising luxury, Evolve Back Coorg offers an experience that nourishes body and soul.

shortDescription: Discover unparalleled exclusivity at Raffles Udaipur, a private island sanctuary on Lake Udai Sagar offering only 101 rooms, legendary Raffles service, and the most intimate luxury wedding experience in Rajasthan.
longDescription:
Raffles Udaipur represents a new pinnacle of luxury hospitality in India—an ultra-exclusive island resort that brings the legendary Raffles service tradition to the romantic setting of Udaipur's lake country. Situated on a 21-acre private island in Lake Udai Sagar, accessible only by private boat, this remarkable property offers couples seeking the ultimate in exclusivity a wedding destination where privacy is absolute, service is legendary, and every moment unfolds in settings of extraordinary beauty.

The resort's design draws inspiration from traditional Mewari architecture while embracing contemporary luxury in every detail. Stone-carved jharokhas, reflective pools, and landscaped courtyards create an atmosphere of timeless elegance. The Raffles Spa, one of the largest in India, occupies its own wing with treatment rooms overlooking the lake. Throughout the property, the design philosophy celebrates space, light, and the integration of indoor and outdoor living that defines the Raffles aesthetic.

With only 101 rooms and suites, Raffles Udaipur maintains the intimate scale that allows for truly personalized service. Every accommodation faces the lake, with private balconies or terraces providing personal viewing spaces for the ever-changing water and sky. The Raffles Suite and Mewari Heritage Suite offer expansive living spaces with private pools. The Raffles Butler service ensures that guest needs are anticipated and fulfilled with graceful precision.

Wedding venues at Raffles Udaipur leverage the island's unique position. The waterfront lawns provide ceremony spaces with the lake stretching to the horizon. The grand pavilion offers elegant covered settings. The infinity pool terrace transforms for sunset celebrations. Indoor spaces provide climate-controlled backup while maintaining lake views. The exclusive island setting means complete privacy—no interruption from external visitors or traffic.

Culinary experiences at Raffles Udaipur blend Indian traditions with international sophistication. Sawai Kitchen presents modern interpretations of Rajasthani cuisine, while Belvedere offers Mediterranean fare. The Long Bar channels the legendary cocktail culture of Raffles Singapore. For weddings, the culinary team creates bespoke menus that honor local traditions while showcasing global influences, executed with the precision that defines Raffles hospitality.

The Raffles Spa provides comprehensive pre-wedding wellness in settings of extraordinary beauty. name: Six Senses Fort Barwara
shortDescription: Step into history at Six Senses Fort Barwara, a magnificently restored 14th-century warrior fort offering authentic Rajasthani grandeur, holistic wellness, and intimate destination weddings near Ranthambore.
longDescription:
Six Senses Fort Barwara represents an extraordinary achievement in heritage restoration—a 14th-century Rajput warrior fort meticulously brought back to life and reimagined as an ultra-luxury wellness resort. Spread across 700 acres encompassing two palaces, two temples, and ancient ramparts, this property offers couples seeking weddings of profound historical significance a venue where every stone tells a story of Rajputana valor and romance. Here, ceremonies unfold in spaces where warriors once gathered, and celebrations echo through halls that have witnessed centuries of noble traditions.

The restoration, overseen by the royal Barwara family in partnership with Six Senses, preserves authentic architectural elements while introducing sensitive contemporary additions. Original frescos, carved jharokhas, ancient courtyards, and temple complexes stand alongside modern amenities invisibly integrated into the historic fabric. The Six Senses commitment to sustainability and wellness creates a holistic experience where heritage, nature, and well-being converge.

With only 48 suites—each occupying original palace or fort quarters—Six Senses Fort Barwara offers exclusivity that larger properties cannot match. Every suite features private courtyards, antique furnishings, and views of the fort walls or surrounding wilderness. The Royal and Burj Suites provide palatial living spaces for the wedding couple. The authentic heritage atmosphere in accommodations makes every guest feel like royal participants in the celebration.

Wedding venues at Six Senses Fort Barwara draw from centuries of history. The Durbar Hall, with its original murals and chandeliers, provides an indoor setting of unmatched authenticity. The temple courtyards offer sacred spaces for ceremonies. The rampart terraces host celebrations with views across the wilderness. The manicured gardens between palace and fort walls create intimate outdoor settings. Every venue carries the weight of history into present celebrations.

Culinary experiences blend royal Rajasthani traditions with Six Senses' global wellness philosophy. Local ingredients, ancient recipes, and health-conscious preparation create menus that honor tradition while supporting well-being. The chefs can recreate royal feast traditions or craft contemporary wellness-focused celebrations. The unique combination of heritage cuisine and modern health consciousness appeals to discerning couples.

The Six Senses Spa incorporates wellness traditions from both Ayurveda and Rajput royal practices, offering comprehensive pre-wedding preparation in extraordinary settings. The proximity to Ranthambore National Park allows wedding guests to experience tiger safaris and wildlife adventures. For couples seeking weddings that connect to living history, nature, and holistic well-being, Six Senses Fort Barwara offers an experience of profound meaning.

Ananda in the Himalayas occupies a place of profound spiritual significance—a 100-acre Maharaja's palace estate overlooking the sacred Ganges as it emerges from the Himalayas near Rishikesh. Consistently ranked among the world's finest destination spas, this extraordinary property offers couples seeking weddings imbued with spiritual meaning a venue where ancient wellness traditions meet contemporary luxury. Here, ceremonies unfold with the holy river below and the Himalayan foothills as witness, creating celebrations of deep significance.

The estate centers on the Viceregal Palace, a heritage building that once hosted British Viceroys and Maharajas. Contemporary additions integrate sensitively, creating spaces that honor history while providing exceptional comfort. The spa, one of the world's largest and most comprehensive, draws from centuries of Ayurvedic, Vedantic, and yogic traditions. Throughout the property, the atmosphere encourages reflection, connection, and transformation.

With 78 rooms distributed between the palace and modern wings, Ananda maintains the intimate scale that defines meaningful wellness experiences. Accommodations blend heritage elegance with contemporary amenities, many featuring private gardens or terraces overlooking the valley. The suites offer expansive spaces for couple preparation and family gatherings.

Wedding venues leverage the spectacular setting with spiritual sensitivity. The palace lawns provide ceremony spaces overlooking the Ganges valley. The heritage courtyard offers intimate gatherings. The viewing deck terraces host sunset celebrations. The private dining pavilions create memorable feast settings. Every venue carries the peaceful energy that defines the Ananda experience.

Culinary philosophy balances wellness principles with celebration requirements. The kitchen specializes in nutritious cuisine that can accommodate various dietary needs while creating memorable wedding feasts. Traditional Indian cuisine alongside international options ensures all guests are satisfied.

The comprehensive spa and wellness programs can prepare couples and families for the wedding journey, offering everything from Ayurvedic panchakarma to yoga and meditation intensives. For couples seeking weddings that nurture body, mind, and spirit while celebrating love, Ananda offers an experience of profound transformation.
